column1: Jervis decides he wants to vote in the upcoming election.
column2: He votes for the Mayor.
column3: Unfortunately his candidate does not win.
column4: Even though his candidate didn't win, Jervis is happy he voted.
column5: He decides he will vote in the next election too.

column1: Sam always wanted to win.
column2: He never got the chance until he was in his twenties.
column3: Sam decided to enter a taco eating competition.
column4: Surprisingly enough he actually won.
column5: Sam was excited for weeks after.

column1: Kate was at her garbage can on a dark night.
column2: And a raccoon was standing near the can.
column3: It started to come towards her.
column4: Kate turned and ran to the house hoping it wasn't behind her.
column5: Once inside was relieved to see it hadn't followed her.

column1: Jake's local movie theater had a horror movie night.
column2: He loved horror movies.
column3: Unfortunately his girlfriend did not.
column4: He finally convinced her to go see one.
column5: She was scared and had nightmares.

column1: The man swept the room.
column2: The woman dropped some food.
column3: The man got mad.
column4: The woman swept the room the next time.
column5: The man didn't care when she dropped food then.

column1: I was at an outdoor mall.
column2: But it was really hot.
column3: I was getting very sweaty.
column4: So I decided to wash my armpits at an empty public bathroom.
column5: I was glad nobody walked in.

column1: David is a large man.
column2: David does not eat healthy things.
column3: One evening while eating his steak David starts feeling a pain.
column4: He feels a pain in his chest and falls to his knees.
column5: David is having a heart attack his wife calls for help.

column1: Rich was a musician.
column2: He made a few hit songs.
column3: Rich had a lot of fans who cared about him.
column4: He developed cancer.
column5: Eventually the cancer took his life and rich was gone.

column1: Sam was a star athlete.
column2: He ran track at college.
column3: There was a big race coming up.
column4: Everyone was sure he would win.
column5: Sam got first place.

column1: Carl wanted a snack to watch television.
column2: He got an opened bag of chips.
column3: He sat to watch.
column4: When he bit a chip it was squishy.
column5: Carl spat it out and threw the chips away.

column1: I am a member of a clan in an online game.
column2: I was asked to help train a new clan.
column3: I had never tried to train anyone before.
column4: After a few months the new clan was competitive.
column5: I didn't realize I knew that much about the game.

column1: I went to the mall today.
column2: I had no plans, I just wanted to shop.
column3: I visited a new store and found a rug on sale.
column4: The rug was weird but it fit my tastes perfectly.
column5: Despite the cost, I bought the rug and I am glad.

column1: Sam was a car dealer.
column2: He tried to sell a car to a customer.
column3: Sam tried to sell it at too high a price.
column4: The customer said they would think about it and go back.
column5: They never returned.

column1: Earlier today I was stuck on the highway due to heavy traffic.
column2: There was a road rage fight and men were fighting on the highway.
column3: There were 3 men and it was 2 against 1.
column4: The guy that was alone had a knife.
column5: He then stabbed the other 2 men and everyone ended up at the hospital.

column1: Craig was diagnosed with cancer.
column2: He decided to fight it.
column3: He tried several different approaches and medications.
column4: Eventually it went into remission.
column5: Craig and his loved ones were thrilled.

column1: I decided to clean out all the closets.
column2: I got a rag and a trash bag.
column3: I went into the closets and picked through the old clothing.
column4: After throwing out the old stuff, I started cleaning.
column5: I wiped down all the shelves and doors.

column1: Kate and her friends were in line outside a club in Las Vegas.
column2: They waited close to an hour.
column3: They were finally able to go inside.
column4: And Kate stepped on a step and broke her heel.
column5: Her night was already ruined.

column1: I was trying to watch my diet.
column2: But my family brought home lots of Mexican food.
column3: I couldn't resist and dug right in.
column4: I ate tons of steak and rice.
column5: But I was glad that I didn't feel bad afterwards.

column1: Maia is an Army brat, so she moves around a lot.
column2: Today, she is starting a new school for the second time this year.
column3: She got her schedule and then went to her first class.
column4: As she headed to an empty seat, other students watched her.
column5: Maia hated being the new girl at school.

column1: Jane only had one pair of glasses.
column2: And she had broken them.
column3: Her mother taped them up and sent her to school.
column4: When she entered the classroom everyone stared at her.
column5: They all pointed and laughed as she stood wishing she could disappear.

column1: The man liked the flavor.
column2: He tried to recreate it at home.
column3: He could not get the flavor right.
column4: He asked the owner of the recipe for help.
column5: The owner of the flavor sold him the recipe.

column1: After my friend's dad's funeral, I got in trouble.
column2: The principal said I wasn't allowed to leave school that day.
column3: He found out I had my friend sign me out.
column4: He told me I was getting detention.
column5: I skipped detention all week.

column1: Janice was out exercising for her big soccer game.
column2: She was doing some drills with her legs.
column3: While working out and exercising she slips on the grass.
column4: She falls down and uses her wrist to break her fall.
column5: She breaks her wrist in the process and goes to the hospital.

column1: Jamie is an american girl.
column2: Jamie wants to get married to a mexican man.
column3: Her family assumes it's because the man wants a green card.
column4: Jamie insist that she is marrying him out of love.
column5: Jamie gets married and they spent the rest of their lives together.

column1: The orange fell from the tree.
column2: It hit a girl on the head.
column3: The girl looked up at the tree.
column4: Another orange fell from the tree.
column5: That orange broke her nose.
